intro: Papualthia irosinensis, commonly known as the Irosin mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
